data.title: Palo Alto Weekly Entertainment Listings
data.text:
The best of what's happening on the Midpeninsula

Alberto's World Dance Music 736 W. Dana St., Mountain View. Brazilian Dance Classes Monday evenings. The Sundogs CD Release Party, April 15, 9 p.m. Call 968-3635.

Alice's Restaurant 17288 Skyline Blvd., Woodside. Grateful Dead Night every Monday, live music/open mike, 8 p.m.-2 a.m. Call 851-0303.

British Bankers Club presents live music Fri. and Sat. nights. 1090 El Camino Real, Menlo Park. Call 327-8769.

California Cafe 700 Welch Road, Palo Alto, 325-2233.

Compadres Mexican Bar & Grill 3877 El Camino Real, Palo Alto, 858-1141.

The Edge 260 California Ave., Palo Alto, 324-EDGE. DJ music and dancing or live band starts at 9 p.m., weekend nights until 3 a.m.

Empire Grill & Tap Room 651 Emerson St., Palo Alto, 321-3030. Dinner jazz in the garden Sundays 4-7 p.m..

Fogg's 303 Bryant St., Mountain View, 390-9696. Jazz and swing for listening and dancing every Tuesday, 7:30 & 9 p.m.

Jose's Caribbean Restaurant 2275 El Camino Real, Palo Alto, 326-6522.

Little Mermaid, 417 California Ave., Palo Alto. Call 326-6812. Classical guitarist Canute Larsen plays Fridays and Saturdays 6-8:30 p.m.

Los Altos Bar and Grill 169 Main St. Call 948-4332. Live music Mon.-Sat. Julie Johnson and Tom Pollitzer, April 12, 19; Moonlighting Acoustic duo, April 13.

Maddalena's Cafe Fino, 544 Emerson St., Palo Alto. Call 326-6082. Jazmin, Tues. and Fri., 7:30 p.m.; Nancy Gilliland singing Gershwin, Wed., Thurs. & Sat., 7:30 p.m.

MacArthur Park 27 University Ave., Palo Alto, 321-9990. Mon.-Sat., 6 to 10:30 p.m. Sun. 10 a.m. to 2:30 and 5:30 to 10 p.m.

Nouveau Trattoria 541 Bryant, Palo Alto. Solo piano Tues., Wed. and Sun. Jazz trio Thurs., Fri. and Sat. All shows 7-11 p.m. Call 327-0132.

Saint Michael's Art Cafe 806 Emerson St., Palo Alto. Live music nightly at 8 p.m. Call 326-2530.

Stanford Park Hotel and Palm Cafe, 100 El Camino Real, Menlo Park. Tues.-Thurs. Call 322-1234.

CONCERTS

Keith Terry & Crosspulse plus San Jose Taiko and Redwood House Choir will join musical forces for a concert of drumming, movement and voice blending together many cultures April 8, 8 p.m., MainStage, Mountain View Center for the Performing Arts, Castro at Mercy, Mountain View. $22. Call 903-6000

Opus 90 contemporary chamber ensemble performs music of local composers based on poetry written by children at the Lucile Salter Packard Children's Hospital, April 8, 8 p.m., Cubberley Theatre, 4000 Middlefield Road, Palo Alto. $8-$12. Call 329-2623.

The Stanford Woodwind Quintet performs works by Francaix, Poulenc, Milhaud and Jongen, April 8, 8 p.m., Campbell Recital Hall, Stanford University. Free. Call 723-3811.

Music and Dance of Bali by Gamelan Sekar Jaya, April 9, 8 p.m., MainStage, Mountain View Center for Performing Arts, Castro at Mercy, Mountain View. $10-$12. Call 903-6000.

Shawn Colvin performs April 9, 8 p.m., Dinkelspiel Auditorium, Stanford University. $20. Call 723-1635.

Kenneth Piascik presents solo percussion concert April 9, 8 p.m., Cultural Center Auditorium, 1313 Newell Road, Palo Alto. $5-$7. Call 852-0428.

Taiwanese Hakka Association of the USA will perform at the First United Methodist Church, 625 Hamilton Ave., on April 9, 2:30 p.m. Tickets prices are $25, $10 and $6

Andrew Lan, violinist, with Mariam Baron, Alfred Lee, Jay Won Lee and Stacey Su perform works by Tchaikovsky and Smetana, April 9, 8 p.m., Campbell Recital Hall, Stanford University. Free. Call 723-3811.

Orion String Quartet performs works by Weill, Haydn and Brahms, April 10, 2:30 p.m., Dinkelspiel Auditorium, Stanford University. $20-$23. Call 725-ARTS.

Music in the Redwoods presents pianist Eileen Shin performing music of the Romantic period April 10, 7:30 p.m., Valley Presbyterian Church, 945 Portola Road, Portola Valley. $5-$7 donation. Call 494-3168.

San Jose Wind Symphony presents a concert featuring saxophonist William Trimble, April 10, 3 p.m., MainStage, Mountain View Center for Performing Arts, Castro at Mercy, Mountain View. $15. Call 903-6000.

Pamela Z uses slinkies, plastic water bottles, hammer handles and her classically trained voice to create pieces with the audience using electronic digital delay, April 10, 4:30 p.m., SecondStage, Mountain View Center for the Performing Arts, Castro at Mercy, Mountain View. $5-$12. This is a Target MusicPlus Family Concert. Call 903-6000.

Fortnightly Music Club presents its April concert featuring John Wells, violin, and Martha Wasley, piano, April 10, 8 p.m., Cultural Center Auditorium, 1313 Newell Road, Palo Alto. Call 948-8556.

Eileen Shin will perform Chopin and Schumann on April 10, 7:30 p.m., at the Valley Presbyterian Church, 945 Potola Road Portola Valley. Donations $7 general, $5 students.

Stanford organist Annette Richards performs the eighth concert in a series of 14 concerts of the complete organ works of J.S. Bach, April 12, 8 p.m., Memorial Church, Stanford University. $4-$7. Call 723-4317.

A Musical Gift to the Community by Marjorie Dufour, Kathleen Martin, Iris Fraser, Anne Peterson and the Sunday Singers Chorus, April 12, 7:30 p.m., First Church of Christ Scientist, Palo Alto. Free.

Philharmonia Baroque Orchestra performs Haydn's great oratorio "The Creation," April 13, 8 p.m., First Methodist Church, Palo Alto. $20-$28. Call 391-5252.

Cowboy Junkies with special guest Freedy Johnston perform April 13, 7:30 p.m., Dinkelspiel Auditorium, Stanford University. $20. Call 725-ARTS.

Paul Winter Consort joined by the Memorial Church Choir, University Lutheran Choir, St. Mark's Choir and Valparaiso Singers, April 15, 8 p.m., Memorial Church, Stanford University. $25. Call 723-2551.

Stanford Symphony Orchestra presents a Pops Concert featuring Disney favorites and works by Liszt, Rossini, Dukas and Von Suppe, April 15, 8 p.m., Dinkelspiel Auditorium, Stanford University. $4-$7. Call 723-3811.

Albany Consort will perform on April 16, 8 p.m., at the Christ Church, 815 Portola Road, Portola Valley and April 17, 3 p.m., at the St. Ann Chapel, Melville Avenue at Cowper Street. Suggested donations $10 general, $8 students and seniors. Call (408) 773-0375.

Cats and Jammers will perform music from 1920s to 1950s on April 16, 8 p.m., at the Covenant Presbytrian Church, 670 E. Meadow Dr. Donation $8. Call 322-6506 or 493-0693.

The Bobs will perform at the Mountain Veiw Center for the Performing Arts, corner of Castro and Mercy streets, April 16, 8 p.m. $22. Call 903-6576.

Sierra Women's Chorus will perform the world premiere of Michael Cleveland's "Requiem" on April 17, 10:30 a.m., First United Methodist Church, 625 Hamilton Ave. Call 323-6167.

St. Mark's Church Concert features Dennis James, Mimi Dye, Rebecca Maggi and James Welch, April 17, 3 p.m., St. Mark's Church, 600 Colorado Ave. Call 321-4422.

Palo Alto Two Piano Club presents its annual concert of duo-piano music, April 17, 2 p.m., Palo Alto Cultural Center, 1313 Newell Road. Pieces by Bach, Bizet, Chopin, among others. Admission $2-4. For more information call 813-5643.

Erin Browne will perform her senior recital at the Campbell Recital Hall, Stanford University, April 17, 8 p.m. Works by Copeland, Ives, Gershwin, among others. Free. Call 723-2720.

The King's Trumpets and Shalmes will perform Renaissance and Baroque wind music, April 17, 8 p.m., St. Bede's Church, 2650 Sand Hill Road, Menlo Park. $10 general, $8 seniors and students. Call 665-2083.

ON STAGE

"Don Juan in Hell," "The Shewing Up of Blanco Posnet," "Poison, Passion and Petrifaction" by Foothill College Conservatory, through April 10, Foothill College's Studio Theatre (A-31). $9 adults; $7.50 seniors and students. Call 948-4444.

"The Musical Comedy Murders of 1940" through April 9 at Los Altos Conservatory Theatre. Call 941-5228.

"West Side Story" by Los Altos Youth Theatre, April 8-9, 8 p.m. and April 9-10, 2 p.m. at the Foothill College Main Theatre, I-280 at El Monte, Los Altos. $8.50 adults; $5.50 for students/seniors. Call 948-6903.

"The World Goes Round" by TheatreWorks, through April 9, Lucie Stern Theatre, 1305 Middlefield Road, Palo Alto. $12-$24. Cal 329-2623.

Oliver by Musical Youth Artists Repertory Theatre, beginning April 8, at the Spangenberg Theatre, 780 Arastradero Road. Call 1-800-400-2985.

Nine by the Palo Alto Players, runs April 16-May 7, at the Lucie Stern Theatre, 1305 Middlefield Road. Call 329-2623.

Story Festival April 17, 2 p.m., Fireside Room, Los Altos United Methodist Church, 655 Magdalena St. Free. Call 494-1383.

"Scotland Road" by TheatreWorks, through April 23, Cubberley Stage II Theatre, 4000 Middlefield Road, Palo Alto. $14. Call 329-2623.

AUDITIONS

Registrations for auditions for the California Youth Symphony are open now. Auditions will take place June 4-5, 9 a.m.-5 p.m., Foothill College, 12345 El Monte Road, Los Altos Hills. Three levels are offered: preparatory groups for strings, wind and brass, the Junior Orchestra and the California Youth Symphony. CYS will also offer a new program for percussion. Call 325-6666.

Auditions for "The Music Man" April 9, 10:30 a.m. and Apri 11, 7-9:30 p.m. at Foothill Music Theatre, Foothill College, I-280 at El Monte Road, Los Altos Hills. Call 949-7414.

Palo Alto Players hold auditions for "Lettuce and Lovage" April 10, 1-5 p.m. and April 12, 7-10 p.m. at the Lucie Stern Theatre, 1305 Middlefield Road, Palo Alto. Needed are 1 man (35-50), 1 woman (20-30), 2 women (30-50) and 10 assorted visitors (any age, children to adult). Director Joe DeGuglielmo requests that those auditioning prepare two two-minute contrasting monologues. Call 329-0891 for appointments.

Wingspread, a summer theater company for young people age 16-24, holds auditions April 12, May 7 and May 26 at 7 p.m., 1305 Middlefield Road, Palo Alto. Call 329-2216.

Children's Theatre Summer Conservatory April 30, 10:30 a.m.; May 18, 4 p.m.; and May 21 at 10:30 a.m., 1305 Middlefield Road, Palo Alto. Call 329-2216.

DANCE

Guelaguetza colorful folkloric dances of the seven regions of the state of Oaxaca, Mexico, April 6, 7:30 p.m., Mountain View Center for Performing Arts, Castro at Mercy, Mountain View. $5. Call 493-3798.

Country Western Dance classes meet Thursdays, April 7-June 9 at the Mid-Peninsula YWCA, 4161 Alma St., Palo Alto. Beginning lessons meet 7:15-8:25 p.m.; continuing lessons meet 8:30-9:45 p.m. $45. Call 494-0972.

Stanford International Dancers with John Burke emphasizing Daichovo, April 8, 7-10 p.m., Mountain View Sports Pavilion, Mountain View. Call Carol (408) 971-1326.

Garmelan Sekar Jaya performs music and dance of Bali, April 9, 8 p.m., Mountain View Center for the Arts, Castro and Mercy, Mountain View. $10-$12. Call 903-6000.

Kongo Village Dance Party Samba Ngo & Ngoma Players, Village Heartbeat Drummers, April 9, 8 p.m., Cubberley Center, 4000 Middlefield Road, Palo Alto. $8-$10. Doors open 6:30 p.m. for African & Vegetarian Cuisine. Call 493-8046.

Ballroom Dance with Phil and Polly Reilly include Swing, Foxtrot, Waltz, Tango, Rhuma, Cha Cha, Bolero, Samba and more. Classes meet Thursdays starting April 14, 7:30 p.m. for new students and 8:30 p.m. for intermediates at the Menlo Park Recreation Dept. The Reillys offer the same program Friday evenings, starting April 15 at the Masonic Temple, 651 Roble Ave., Menlo Park. Call 322-9026.

Country-western style line dance class begins April 15, 6:30-7:45 p.m. at the YMCA, 3412 Ross Road, Palo Alto. Call 494-1883.

Dance to Mark Teel and his Orchestra, music from the Big Band era, April 17 at the Hyatt Rickeys, Palo Alto. 6:30-9:30 p.m. Dance only: $12.50 per person; dinner and dance: $17.50 per person. 2,500-square-foot dance floor. Call 323-3394.

REUNIONS

Alpha Chi Omega Carnation Reunion luncheon April 16 at the historic Officers' Club at Fort Mason in San Francisco. Deadline for reservations is April 7. Call Betty Fahs at 961-0116.

Sequoia High School Class of 1942 announces a reunion luncheon to be held April 23 at the Redwood City Elks Club. Call 368-1839.
